body: I'd be happy to help investigate and fix this, but I'm not sure where this lock platform is determined.

I'd missed that you were using Rails 7.1.0. For 7.1.0 specifically (but not the most recent 7.1.x release), the relevant code seems to be: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/d39db5d1891f7509cde2efc425c9d69bbb77e670/railties/lib/rails/generators/app_base.rb#L676-L690

It looks to me like this is a bug in Rails 7.1, but 7.1 is no longer doing bugfix releases, and the JRuby database adapter support was removed from `rails new` in 7.2.

@maxfelsher That is unfortunate news. There are JRuby users hoping to upgrade to Rails 8 for their apps and the removal will make that very difficult. Do you know why this decision was made and who we can talk to about reversing it?

@headius I wasn't involved in the decision, but I see that the JRuby-related code in the generator was removed in https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/51765 as part of a general streamlining process that also removed some other database options. I don't have JRuby set up to test, so I don't know how/if that removal affects upgrades of existing JRuby Rails apps. I also don't know what the expected workflow is for those who want to generate an entirely new Rails app with JRuby.

@maxfelsher Thanks for your help. Seems like it's would still be possible to generate apps by specifying the database adapter with -d but I have asked whether we could get that code restored, or customize the new command some other way. 

Unfortunately without a Rails 7.1 update release the issue reported here may never get fixed

> I have asked whether we could get that code restored, or customize the new command some other way.

I think you'll want a [template](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/rails_application_templates.html)

> > I have asked whether we could get that code restored, or customize the new command some other way.
> 
> I think you'll want a [template](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/rails_application_templates.html)

Ah, then perhaps the original issue (adding a platform that doesn't make sense in the JRuby context) is still a bug in Rails? Maybe it's as simple as changing the `if bundle_install?` check to `if bundle_install? && !defined?(JRUBY_VERSION)`.

@skipkayhil Thank you! 

@maxfelsher Oh yeah duh, we probably would want to fix it for newer versions anyway. If that can't be customized using a template then we'll need to lobby to fix it in Rails proper.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails team are limited, and so we are asking for your help.
If you can still reproduce this error on the `8-0-stable` branch or on `main`, please reply with all of the information you have about it in order to keep the issue open.
Thank you for all your contributions.

issue.title: Don't add bundler platforms for JRuby
issue.body:
The gems used by a Rails application on JRuby can't be resolved in other platforms.

Fixes #54894.
